@elementpictures @goldenglobes @lobsterfilm Fantastic performance, deserves to be gonged. Good luck!
Me too (defibrillator at the ready at all times) https://t.co/qT4yBfuImG
@thecailinrua Thanks, same to you. As @lizzienugent noted yesterday, JK Rowling's probably knocked off a chapter while we've been tweeting!
@thecailinrua Nor have I personally (though like everyone, it's affected people close to me). Did you see this? https://t.co/gNaElZbCwf
@thecailinrua They're getting to talk about cancer on air for free, in many multiples of 30 seconds. Like I say, let's see how it plays out
@thecailinrua Let's see what reaction it does achieve. I notice that ICS are on 98FM in 15 minutes talking about their issue again.
@thecailinrua The headline is what makes you read on (or, in most advertising, fails to). Here it's spawning debate. Hard to do with bland.
@thecailinrua I'm guessing that having the campaign - and therefore the issue - as third item on RTE News will count as a win for ICS
@thecailinrua It's actually surprisingly hard to alienate people. It's scarily easy to spend 250k (or whatever) with absolutely no impact
@thecailinrua Yes, I have (Not on this campaign, I should add). Not looking for a row, btw, just giving alt opinion. "With respect" genuine
@thecailinrua Client base isn't target market. If seeking to raise awareness/funding, probably targeting people not currently v cancer-aware
@thecailinrua Most advertising is ignored. I'm guessing the target market here will investigate this campaign further. A win, for me.
@thecailinrua @IrishCancerSoc Politics - that's a different story
@thecailinrua @IrishCancerSoc Actually, with respect, I think you're wrong. In the world of advertising, when you're noticed you're winning
@GreenClouds4 They're delusional, I'm afraid.
@GreenClouds4 Commons not following through on popular vote theoretically possible but not politically. There'd be a revolution.
@mark_tuthill Beautifully written and powerful, great work Mark.
